thread.title: Hull 2 - Man Utd 1 (Agg 2-3): Red Devils set up Southampton Wembley final despite defeat
thread.title_full: Hull 2 - Man Utd 1 (Agg 2-3): Red Devils set up Southampton Wembley final despite defeat

title: Hull 2 - Man Utd 1 (Agg 2-3): Red Devils set up Southampton Wembley final despite defeat
text:
Premier League Championship Scottish Premiership Hull 2 - Man Utd 1 (Agg 2-3): Red Devils set up Southampton Wembley final despite defeat MANCHESTER UNITED will face Southampton at Wembley despite losing to Hull in the second-leg of their EFL CUP semi-final. PUBLISHED: 20:57, Thu, Jan 26, 2017 | UPDATED: 21:37, Thu, Jan 26, 2017 REUTERS Paul Pogba scored Manchester United's equaliser against Hull 
United, who were already 2 goals ahead after the last week's first-leg, started slowly. 
And it was Hull who had the first chance of the match when Oumar Niasse lashed a shot towards goal, but David De Gea was able to punch clear. 
The Tigers were then given the chance to take the lead from the spot when both Harry Maguire and Niasse were bundled over. GETTY Tom Huddlestone opened the scoring for Hull 
Tom Huddlestone stepped up and buried the spot kick past De Gea to give Hull hope in the tie. 
Marco Silva's side were almost pegged back when Zlatan Ibrahimovic curled the ball towards goal, but David Marshal produced a fine one-handed save. 
After the break United thought they should have had a penalty when Huddlestone bundled over Chris Smalling, but nothing was given. 
But soon after the Red Devils put the tie to bed as Marcus Rashford broke into the area and Huddlestone could only divert the ball into the path of Paul Pogba, who toe-poked the ball home. Fans react as Man United announce team to face Hull in EFL Cup Thu, January 26, 2017 Express Sport brings you all the best tweets as Manchester United fans react to their starting XI to face Hull in the EFL Cup semi-final second leg Man Utd via Getty Images 1 of 12 Fans react to Jose Mourinho's starting XI to face Hull in the EFL Cup semi-final 
United then almost took the lead when Marcos Rojo got free at a corner, but his header bounced on the crossbar and away. 
Hull kept fighting, and almost found a way back into the tie when Niasse rose to meet a corner, but his strike thumped the crossbar. 
However, Niasse did get his goal soon after to give Hull hope of a comeback when he vollyed home from close range. 
But the Tigers ran out of time as Manchester United set up a clash with Southampton at Wembley next month. Related articles
